meanings.definition: a person who copies the behavior or actions of another
meanings.sent1: The imitator mimicked every move the dancer made.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the best imitator in the school, always copying her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The imitator at the party had everyone laughing with their spot-on impressions.
meanings.sent4: His skills as an imitator were so precise, it was like watching a mirror reflection.
meanings.sent5: The imitator's talent for imitation was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: something that imitates, such as a replica or counterfeit
meanings.sent1: The artist created an imitator of the famous painting.
meanings.sent2: The market was flooded with cheap imitators of the designer handbag.
meanings.sent3: The imitator watch may look real, but it stops working after a week.
meanings.sent4: The imitator of the sculpture lacked the intricate details of the original.
meanings.sent5: Beware of imitators claiming to be the real deal.
